item.title: Allena add a quote by Sarah Kay
item.description: "Because there is nothing more beautiful than the way the ocean refuses to stop kissing the shoreline, no matter how many times it's sent away" -- Sarah Kay

item.title: Allena add a quote by Sarah Kay
item.description: "Life will hit you hard in the face, wait for you to get back up just so it can kick you in the stomach. But getting the wind knocked out of you is the only way to remind your lungs how much they like the taste of air." -- Sarah Kay

item.title: Allena add a quote by Brigham Young
item.description: "You educate a man; you educate a man. You educate a woman; you educate a generation." -- Brigham Young

item.title: Allena add a quote by Cheris Kramarae
item.description: "Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings." -- Cheris Kramarae

item.title: Allena add a quote by Roseanne Barr
item.description: "The thing women have yet to learn is nobody gives you power. You just take it. " -- Roseanne Barr

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "A feminist is anyone who recognizes the equality and full humanity of women and men." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Allena add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "Remember, remember always, that all of us, and you and I especially, are descended from immigrants and revolutionists." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Allena add a quote by Hazel Rochman
item.description: "Reading makes immigrants of us all. It takes us away from home, but more important, it finds homes for us everywhere. ." -- Hazel Rochman

item.title: Allena add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "The more you can increase fear of drugs, crime, welfare mothers, immigrants and aliens, the more you control all of the people." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Allena add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "But it makes an immigrant laugh to hear the fears of the nationalist, scared of infection, penetration, miscegenation, when this is small fry, <i>peanuts,</i> compared to what the immigrant fears - dissolution, <i>disappearance.</i> " -- Zadie Smith

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria Anzaldua
item.description: "The struggle is inner: Chicano, indio, American Indian, mojado, mexicano, immigrant Latino, Anglo in power, working class Anglo, Black, Asian--our psyches resemble the bordertowns and are populated by the same people. The struggle has always been inner, and is played out in outer terrains. Awareness of our situation must come before inner changes, which in turn come before changes in society. Nothing happens in the "real" world unless it first happens in the images in our heads." -- Gloria Anzaldua

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria Anzaldúa
item.description: "Though we tremble before uncertain futures may we meet illness, death and adversity with strength may we dance in the face of our fears. " -- Gloria Anzaldúa

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria Anzaldúa
item.description:
"Caminante, no hay puentes, se hace puentes al andar.
(Voyager, there are no bridges, one builds them as one walks.) " -- Gloria Anzaldúa

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria Anzaldua
item.description: "I change myself, I change the world." -- Gloria Anzaldua

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria Anzaldúa
item.description: "Wild tongues can't be tamed, they can only be cut out." -- Gloria Anzaldúa

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria Anzaldua
item.description: "I am mad - but I choose this madness." -- Gloria Anzaldua

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria E. Anzaldúa
item.description: "Do work that matters. Vale la pena" -- Gloria E. Anzaldúa

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria Anzaldúa
item.description: "All reaction is limited by, and dependant on, what it is reacting against." -- Gloria Anzaldúa

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria Anzaldua
item.description: "I can't seem to stay out of my own way." -- Gloria Anzaldua

item.title: Allena add a quote by Gloria E. Anzaldúa
item.description: "A woman who writes has power, and a woman with power is feared." -- Gloria E. Anzaldúa

item.title: Allena add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it." -- Rumi

item.title: Allena add a quote by Jalal Ad-Din Rumi
item.description:
"Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing there is a field. I'll meet you there.
When the soul lies down in that grass the world is too full to talk about." -- Jalal Ad-Din Rumi

item.title: Allena add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "What you seek is seeking you." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Allena add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "The wound is the place where the Light enters you." -- Rumi

item.title: Allena add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "My soul is from elsewhere, I'm sure of that, and I intend to end up there." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Allena add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Allena add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Words are a pretext. It is the inner bond that draws one person to another, not words." -- Rumi
